DOC.HEAD: Parachutist Killed in Leap from High-Rise
DOC.TEXT: One of several sky divers who leaped from a high-rise was killed early Sunday when his parachute either became tangled or snagged on the building, authorities said. The 57-year-old man, whose name was not immediately released, jumped from the Century City building more than 40 stories high about 1:30 a.m. with four or five other people, said police Sgt. Curt Hussey. He plunged into a construction site. The victim was flown to UCLA Medical Center, where he died later in the morning, Hussey said. Another parachutist, whose name was not released, was cited for trespassing. The other sky divers fled before police arrived, Hussey said.
